oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) for January-March 1916; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. Includes reports from the New York Ladies' Auxiliary, the St. Louis Ladies' Auxiliary, the Cincinnati Ladies' Auxiliary, the Cleveland Ladies' Auxiliary, the Holyoke Ladies' Auxiliary, the St. Louis Young People's JCRS, the Baltimore Ladies' Auxiliary, and the Tyler Ladies' Auxiliary. Also includes portraits of Ladies' Auxiliary officers.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) for July-August 1909 ; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. Includes an article about the need for separate Orthodox Jewish institutions, a description of Yehoash's appearance at the Chicago Hebrew Institute in May 1909, and a list of subscriptions and donors.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) sixth annual meeting on March 27, 1910, and its operations and finances for the period beginning January 1, 1909, and ending December 31, 1909; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. The Secretary's report indicates that 298 patients were treated in 1909. Includes images of the facility, statistical data about the patients (including age, occupation, and duration of disease), and a list of all donors.

Report of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) annual meeting on November 10-12, 1912, and its operations and finances for the period beginning January 1, 1911, and ending December 31, 1911; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak was the Secretary. The Secretary's report indicates that 269 patients were treated in 1911, and includes data about patients treated from 1904-1911. Includes images of the facility, statistical data about the patients (including age, occupation, and duration of disease), and a list of all donors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society Records, Publications

Report of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) annual meeting on April 27, 1913, and its operations and finances for the period beginning January 1, 1912, and ending December 31, 1912; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak was the Secretary. The Secretary's report indicates that 218 patients were treated in 1912. Includes images of the facility, statistical data about the patients (including age, occupation, and duration of disease), and a list of all donors. Includes photographs of National Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) officers, Ladies' Auxiliary officers, and ''The Three Fat Men of the Sanatorium.''
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society Records, Publications
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Copyright restrictions may apply. User is responsible for all copyright compliance

Includes statistical data about the patients (including age, occupation, and duration of disease), images of Ladies' Auxiliary officers, and a list of all donors from 1904-1913.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) for July-August 1915 ; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. Includes several articles about Jewish autopsies and port-mortem examinations, a memorial for Ignatz Katz, and a list of contributions. Also includes portraits of Ignatz Katz, Dr. Adolph Hershkovitz, and Jacob N. Cown.

Reports issued in combined form for the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS) annual meetings on May 20, 1915 and April 23, 1916; Dr. Philip Hillkowitz was the Society's President, and C.D. Spivak the Secretary. The Secretary's report indicated that 2,451 patients were treated from September 8, 1904 to December 31, 1915. Includes summaries of expenditures, portraits of national officers, and a list of all subscribers and donors.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society Records, Publications
